Full Description: CEO David Richards and Chief Scientist Dr. Aahlad co-founded WANdisco in 2005. Wanelo (“wah-nee-loh,” from Want, Need, Love) is a mall on your phone, curated by people. It helps you find the most amazing products in the universe. A regular mall has 150 stores, but on Wanelo you’ll find over 350,000 stores which include all the big brands you know, as well as tiny independent boutiques and sellers you’ve never heard of. Wanelo is also a way to search and follow all of your favorite stores in one place. It's used by millions of people who post tens of thousands of new products to Wanelo every day. Wanelo was launched in 2012 by Deena Varshavskaya, who was frustrated with shopping in traditional malls. Her personal style didn’t fit a simple category and she wanted to shop in more unique places. She decided to create a social network that would make it easy to discover amazing stores and products from anywhere online. Deena worked on Wanelo for more than two years using her own savings before attracting Wanelo’s first users. In 2011, she moved to San Francisco and raised funding after 40 investor rejections. Today, Wanelo is a team of 35, and millions of people are using it to find and buy products they love.

Categories: Facial Recognition, Information Technology, Mobile, Photography
Full Description: Waldo is a photo finding phenom. With Waldo, every photo of you and your family, taken by others, is delivered to your smart phone. Whether it is at a football game, concert, amusement park, wedding, tourist attraction, triathlon or your just chillin’ at a friend’s BBQ, Waldo finds your photos and delivers them back to you. Waldo uses a combination of facial recognition, GPS, time and album code matching with the convenience of a text-based interface. The Waldo platform helps professional photographers increase their sales by changing the process from an antiquated hunt and peck, wait in line, one-off commerce transaction to a push system in which the potential customer is delivered their “photo needles” out of the proverbial “album haystack” to their smart phone, in real-time, with one click purchasing. For consumers, Waldo lets you live in the moment, put down the selfie stick, put your phone back in your pocket and enjoy life’s most valued moments. The days of wishing you could have gotten that incredible photo from an amazing photographer are here and the days of constantly nagging friends and family or feeling guilty about hoarding photos of others are over. Waldo is an intelligent, predictive, cloud-based, text-enabled, facial recognition driven platform which lets photos flow from the photographer to the photographed, as seamlessly as it should be. Put the power of Waldo in your pocket and enjoy the moment!

Wave Money operates as a mobile financial services provider. Wave Money is a financial service platform targeting the unbanked population in Myanmar. It is the first company to be regulated under the Mobile Financial Services Regulation and to secure a licence from the Central Bank of Myanmar.

Wallix Product ( WAB Suite) gives the most effective route to security and compliance by mitigating its users’ biggest security risk – privileged access to IT – in the shortest possible time. WALLIX was founded in 2003 with a simple vision to create the most effective and complete solution to the challenges of managing privileged user access. The result of that vision is Wallix AdminBastion (WAB) Suite, a powerful combination of password, access and session management with detailed monitoring and auditing for privileged users’ activity, that now protects hundreds of customers around the world to mitigate external attacks, to control third party access, to prevent insider threat, or to meet their regulatory compliance.

Interactive Entertainment, Warner Bros. Television, Warner Bros. Animation, Warner Home Video, New Line Cinema, Castle Rock Entertainment, DC Entertainment. Categories: Human Computer Interaction, Industrial Automation, Machine Learning, Robotics, Wearables
Full Description: Wandelbots is a german startup that enables non-programmers to teach industrial robots faster and cheaper using smart clothing. Based on sensors attached to clothes, the Wandelbots software backend tracks human motion to live-control industrial robots. Operators can teach automation tasks by demonstration. The software backend builds a machine learning model based on several demonstrations and generates automation worklfows. They can be refined and optimized with the software tool.  The generated processes are self-adaptive, so learned processes can automatically be used in dynamic environments. This adaptation includes automatic anomaly detection, process adaptation and MES-integration.

Categories: Green Consumer Goods, Health Care, Sustainability, Water
Full Description: Waiakea Water is a bottled water company founded on three pillars: health, sustainability, and ethics. Beyond providing consumers with healthy, tasty water sourced from the active Mauna Loa volcano on the Big Island of Hawaii, Waiakea aims to maintain and prioritize the environment, as well as give back to disadvantaged communities. Health - The Water Waiakea Water flows from the peaks of the Mauna Loa volcano through porous, mineral-rich rock, enriching the water and making it naturally alkaline and full of electrolytes. Waiakea Water is one of the most alkaline natural waters currently available, with a pH of 8.8 and a TDS of 62. Sustainability - The Process from Start to Finish The source of Waiakea Water has a 1.4 billion gallon per day recharge rate. As a result, Waiakea bottles less than .0001 of 1% of this. Even further, Waiakea uses low-emissions vehicles to transport the water. The bottles that hold Waiakea Water are 100% RPET, which results in a carbon footprint that is 90% smaller than that of traditional plastic bottles, and, recently, Waiakea announced that they would be transitioning to fully degradable bottles in the near future. They are also the only bottled water company to be certified CarbonNeutral®. Ethics - Giving Back Waiakea has partnered with PumpAid to provide clean water to disadvantaged communities. For every liter of Waiakea Water purchased, Waiakea donates 1 week of clean water to those in need in Africa and throughout the world through the help of their partner organization.

Full Description: Founded in 2017, Wasteless is helping supermarkets and the planet fight one of their biggest problems — food waste. It provides a machine learning and real­time tracking solution for grocery stores to offer customers dynamic pricing based on product expiration date. Using its proprietary machine-learning pricing engine, Wasteless can price products dynamically in real time based on a series of variables, including the expiration date, shelf capacity, regional factors, brand strength, on-shelf competition, and more. Prices are displayed on electronic shelf labels or online checkouts, where consumers can see the product’s regular price as well as a discounted price for a specific expiration date. Wasteless is based in Tel Aviv, Israel.

WaterBit provides growers with highly granular, real-time and low cost sensing systems to improve crop quality and yield by optimizing resource use. Additionally, unlike capacitance and TDR based sensors, it works in any soil type – including amended soils and potting soils. Wangsu Science & Technology also provides Dynamic Site Accelerator solution for dynamic interactive Websites; Accessing Accelerator solution; HTTPS Security Accelerator for various security protection, and dynamic and static resource planning; and Overseas Accelerator solution for multi-device and acceleration solutions. Moreover, it offers Wangsu Shield cloud security solutions for Websites that include DDoS Mitigation service for various types of DDoS attacks, such as SYN Flood, ACK Flood, UDP Flood, HTTP Flood, etc.; Web Application Firewall; and Bot Guard, as well as security management and security services.  Further, Wangsu Science & Technology operates Website security monitoring platform; and cloud video platform for live streaming, VOD, video AI, media processing, video uploading, and cloud video services. Additionally, it offers Website Defacement system; data center solutions; and cloud computing solutions that include computing, storage, networks, security, data base, CDN, management and development, domains and analytics, middleware, and instant messaging.  Wangsu Science & Technology serves online interactive quiz, government, automotive, gaming, video, finance, appliance manufacturing, e-commerce, mobile live streaming, media, FMCG, education, and consumer electronics sectors. It began operation in January 2000, with its headquarters in Shanghai in China.

When Sam and Helen Walton launched their modest retail business in 1962, one of their goals was to increase opportunity and improve the lives of others along the way. This guiding principle has played a major role in the phenomenal growth of their small enterprise into a global retail leader. This principle – to the benefit of deserving people and inspiring projects around the world – also drives the philanthropic mission of the Walton Family Foundation. Today the foundation is more focused than ever on sustaining the Walton’s timeless small-town values and their deep commitment to making life better for individuals and communities alike. By working with grantees and collaborating with other philanthropic organizations, the foundation is dedicated to making a positive difference in three focus areas:
Wakie is a fun, friendly community of people who wake each other up in the morning. It’s a brand new way to wake up, made especially for those of us who hate the jarring noise of an alarm clock.

Wandoujia launched its first product in 2010: a desktop phone manager for Android and has since pioneered mobile search products to help users discover and consume content. It has helped foreign developers like Flipboard, Evernote, Pocket, and LINE release their apps in China. Wandoujia has a [developer center here](http://developer.wandoujia.com/intl/). And Wandoujia's international version, [SnapPea](www.snappea.com), was launched in June 2012. Wandoujia also publishes [The Mobile Search Index](http://appindex.wandoujia.com/), a monthly report on Chinese trends in mobile search. The team is based in Beijing, with more than 250 employees and four cats.

Wandering Bear Coffee brings fresh, uniquely bold, smooth cold brew to homes and offices. Our goal has always been to put the best-tasting coffee possible in your cup. We modeled our cold brew off the stuff we would often seek out from our favorite coffee shops around New York City. Our brew is bold (so it stands up to ice), but uniquely smooth with a bright, chocolaty finish. And it’s always ready to drink. We’re proud to say that we were the first to realize that putting cold brew coffee in a box with a tap was a really cool idea. Keeping our cold brew fresh was always a challenge when we brewed at home. So we eliminated the two things that make coffee go stale: air and light. Now you can have a personal tap in your home or office fridge. Push a button, customize and enjoy.

Full Description: Walk Score is the world's leading measure of neighborhood walkability and helps people find places to live with short commutes and great nearby places. Walk Score also provides data about walkability, public transit, biking, car sharing, and other neighborhood characteristics to analysts in the real estate, public health, and financial industries. An independent study by CEOs for Cities found that one point of Walk Score is worth up to $3,000 depending on the metro area. The Walk Score mission is to promote walkable neighborhoods for their environmental, health, and economic benefits.  Walk Score currently supports the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand.

Full Description: At WayBetter, we’re pioneering a whole new category of life-changing games. Imagine games that make it fun to lose weight … exercise more … sleep better … quit smoking. Our DietBets are hosted by fitness experts like Jillian Michaels, Chris and Heidi Powell, and Shaun T. We plan to use our model to create new games like StepBet, to take more steps each day, which we’re launching in 2016 … plus SleepBet, CardioBet, and CigaBet.

Waste Management, Inc. is a leading provider of integrated environmental solutions in North America. Waste Management is a leading provider of comprehensive environmental solutions services in North America, serving more than 21 million customers in the U.S. and Canada. As part of their strategy, they are committed to developing new waste solutions that can help communities and organizations achieve their green goals, including zero waste. With the largest network of recycling facilities, transfer stations and landfills in the industry, their entire business can adapt to meet the needs of every distinct customer segment, including municipalities, construction sites, healthcare facilities, commercial buildings and many others. As North America’s largest residential recycler, their goal is to manage more than 20 million tons of recyclable material each year by 2020. Last year, they managed more than 15 million tons.  Waste Management is also a renewable energy provider.  One of the ways they do this is by recovering the naturally occurring gas inside landfills to generate electricity, called landfill-gas-to-energy. By the end of 2014, they operated over 134 beneficial-use landfill-gas projects, producing enough energy to power nearly 500,000 homes.

Wave Systems Corp. develops, produces, and markets hardware-based digital security solutions. Wave management tools build on specifications developed by the Trusted Computing Group, such as the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) security chip and self-encrypting drive (SED), to secure organizations from the hardware level up. Wave’s software makes these existing industry-standard hardware technologies useful on an enterprise scale with remote, centralized management, audit logs for regulatory compliance, and granular policy controls. The result is a fully-managed, hardware-based solution for encryption, authentication, malware detection and Data Loss Protection. Wave has partnered with OEMs like Acer, Asus, Dell, Fujitsu, HP and Lenovo; and drive manufacturers including Micron, Samsung and Seagate. The company was formerly known as Cryptologics International, Inc. and changed its name to Wave Systems Corp. in January 1993. Wave was founded in 1988 and is based in Lee, Massachusetts, with offices in Cupertino, CA; Princeton, NJ; Frankfurt; London; Paris; Tel Aviv; The Hague; and Zurich.

It enables so far unused real-time optimizations, innovates exhibitors’ lead-generation, supports selling products or services more efficiently and serves attendees with an overall new experience. 100% coverage without the need of a smartphone app or any customer interaction at all, is what makes us unique and a pioneer. Categories: Artificial Intelligence, Developer APIs, Developer Platform, Developer Tools, Machine Learning, SaaS, Software
Full Description: Wavio, the future leader in sound recognition software. Our proprietary algorithm/ software gives any technology the sense of hearing (beyond just speech and music). By understanding what is happening around these products, Wavio can enable devices and services with contextual awareness, empowering multiple applications across key values such as safety, security, wellbeing, health, entertainment and communication. Wavio run as a Reactive Web Application enabling developers to deploy install-and-run sound recognition software capitalizing on proprietary audio signal processing algorithms through an intuitive development console. After registering and setting up sound assistant(s), users can download them into anything running Linux. The Wavio sound assistant software can detect the relative source and type of real-time sounds via a sound recognizing assistant installed on a microphone hardware through command line interface tools (CLI). Market include but not limited to: developer tool platform, consumer technology, robotics, AI, security, automotive and smartphones. How did Wavio come to be? Greyson Watkins, the company’s founder, is profoundly Deaf. Back in 2014, he was taking care of a little girl. The little girl accidentally tripped and fell down the stairs and cried for his help. Greyson couldn’t hear her crying until she had to walk over to get his attention. He was struck with an overwhelming feeling of helplessness. From this realization, Wavio was founded in 2015 with a social impact vision to make generic, ambient sounds accessible by integrating sound recognition software on machines. In doing so, Greyson envisioned a world where everyone and everything can be aware of the surrounding sounds, and where machines can communicate efficiently via IoT solutions intelligently responding to specific sounds such as those associated with emergencies, natural disasters, context and other life-threatening scenarios. Wavio is consisted of a diverse and innovative group of people who strive to generate impact and transform the way we think about sound recognition and sound contextual awareness capitalizing on AI technologies. If you agree with our problem and how we solve it, contact us to collaborate as an investor, advisor or mentor. Currently seeking for another technical co-founder and a marketing co-founder as well. https://angel.co/wavio-2

Full Description: Walmoo is the very first Loyalty-as-a-service solution that allows businesses to implement a customizable, simple to use and affordable loyalty program in minutes, leveraging NFC / QR technologies and that is accessible 100% self-service which means that the business is in full control of his customer loyalty program from day one. Walmoo loyalty solution consists of an Android and/or Web-based terminal apps and web-based administration panel for business. For customer identification, there are few options to choose from. Either it's an NFC card or tag or printed or digitally stored QR code. Another unique thing about Walmoo is that it's the very first solution which allows for business either to provide it's own custom NFC loyalty card either use ANY contactless bank card, transport card, or loyalty tags their customers may have already in their wallets! They just register their existing NFC tag by swiping next to Walmoo terminal and start using it as a loyalty card. So in the cities where there is a contactless card for public transport, like Oyster card in London, people can use the same card in stores as their loyalty card. Walmoo will work for multiple businesses. The idea is to have all small business in an area use Walmoo for their customer loyalty. That way, it is only one QR code or card for the customer to use, and it builds support among small business in the area.   Walmoo solution's flat Pay-as-you-Use pricing model is a perfect way to keep it affordable regardless of the business size as it adjusts the needs. The forever free (each month's first 50 visitors) plan without functional limitations is a great deal for very small businesses and for testing the solution without trial time limitations.  Walmoo company is established in 2014 in Latvia which is one of the Baltic states located in Northern Europe. The project has 2200+ registered business customers from more than 50 different countries. Walmoo Loyalty-as-a-Service solutions is built using Walmoo's identification & engagement platform with loyalty engine which has been used in solutions around loyalty programs, ski resort ticketing solutions and solutions for events.

It is essentially a Web/mobile recruitment solution and SAAS, with a monthly subscription or pay per use model for B2B and B2B long tail customers.  WasabiJobs stands out from its competitors thanks to our technology, we are the first international recruiting platform (present in the US, UK, Germany, France, Italy and Spain), with a DNA of social conscience that rewards the best candidates.

With limited or no vision, navigating an unfamiliar environment means you are wholly reliant on auditory cues or a sighted guide for directions. Categories: Computer, Internet of Things, Social Media, Software
Full Description: VR users, today, experience their movement with legacy controllers like gamepads, keyboards or, at best, with new generation room scale controllers provided by HTC or Oculus. Legacy controllers, since your brain knows you are physically sitting, can not emulate the real body movement. You move in the game, you see and hear the actions but you don't really physically move. Therefore, at the end: You feel motion sickness. WalkOVR also provides you an infinite space of movement; which can not be even provided by new generation motion controllers. Because they are still limited to room and your room walls. When you use HTC Vive or Oculus controllers, you have to keep yourself in a circle. WalkOVR solves these main problems in VR and provide the real immersive experience. It has mechanical and electronical groups of components; combined with lower and upper pieces. Mechanical and wearable structure lets users move freely but prevents them from changing real life location. In the meantime electronical sensors tracks user movements and transfer them to VR apps.

WavoDyne Therapeutics Inc. is a new company formed for the purpose of commercializing a group of novel small molecule therapeutics which have displayed exceptional potency in preclinical models for the treatment of memory and cognitive disorders resulting from neuroinflammatory processes. The Company’s product pipeline represents 20 years of innovative research which has been funded by $25 mm of various grants from the National Institute of Health. WavoDyne Therapeutics has entered into a licensing transaction with the University of Rochester Medical Center, the site of preclinical research that generated the portfolio of clinical drug candidates. The license provides WavoDyne Therapeutics exclusivity on a series of patented novel drug candidates which have high selectivity for inhibition of the Mixed Lineage Kinases. The Company anticipates commencing a Phase 1 clinical study by 2Q2016 with its lead drug candidate, URMC-099, which will target the treatment of POCD ( Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction ). Another Ph. 1 study with this drug candidate is planned to commence in 2016 for the treatment of HAND ( HIV Associated Neurocognitive Disorders ). The treatment of cognitive disorders associated with Multiple Sclerosis and Parkinson’s Disease also figure prominently in the Company’s project plans. Based on standard drug development timelines, regulatory requirements, and the timely completion of our pivotal clinical trials, WavoDyne expects to launch its first product for the treatment of POCD in the 2021-2022 timeframe.

Under 10 year service agreement with several municipalities [for $8MM plus yearly revenue], the company will build primarily a municipal solid waste [MSW] & Industrial waste recycling plant in Alajuela, Costa Rica, and the business model is based on the 3R [Reduce, Reuse and Recycle] principle of the waste management law of the country. All recyclable materials will be collected from the installed advanced MRF [material recovery facility] system & sold to buyers like Coca Cola, Florida Bebidas, and others [$25 MM a year or more in revenues, based on historical market performance].    Next, the plant will produce engineered fuel called RDF [Refuse Derived Fuel] using non-recyclable plastics, papers and cardboards, textiles, wood fractions, rubbers, etc. RDF will be used for waste-to-energy applications that meet both US EPA and EU environmental regulation standards. The company has received a off take contract for the RDF from a large cement company in Costa Rica.    The organic faction for the waste will go to landfill for a short while until the parent company builds and commissions its waste-to-energy plant, which has received all permits but the environmental approval is pending. [Ultimately both the RDF and organic waste will become the feedstock for the WtE plant. This WtE project is a separate project that is not ready for funding yet.]     MRF Technology: Well established throughout the world, especially in developed countries, with proven track records of success. Municipalities and waste management companies in the US and Europe are the major users of this technology. The turnkey system will be fully bonded/insured for performance guarantee.     The project has acquired all permits including environmental license to proceed with construction permit.

Waterfund is a global water investment and trading firm, focused on acquiring and managing infrastructure assets utilizing the latest technology in desalination and wastewater treatment to produce and sell clean water to the highest-value end users.  We manage a portfolio of assets that capture the rising value of water globally while rationalizing consumption and promoting sustainable patterns of water use to preserve this vital resource for the future.   Waterfund leverages a distinct data advantage in identifying investment destinations and opportunities, the Water Cost Index (WCI).  Developed alongside IBM Research’s Accelerated Discovery Lab, the Waterfund WCI establishes a proprietary benchmark to measure the true cost of producing potable water in various cities and regions around the world.  Waterfund uses the Index to identify locations with the greatest “cost to price delta,” i.e. the gap between the full cost of water production and local tariffs.  This provides an indication of places where there may be significant operational inefficiencies on the part of local utilities coupled with ample scope for future price increases – compelling investment environments for Waterfund.

Waterscope is a not-for-profit impact-defined company based in Cambridge. Waterscope is a Cambridge University spin-out developing easy-to-use, rapid water testing microscopes capable of identifying bacterial presence in drinking water. Their bacterial imaging device can identify specific bacterial micro-colonies in less than 6 hours, four times faster than current gold-standard portable systems. Their system is automated, not requiring significant user training. Using image recognition software, bacterial colonies can be automatically identified and counted. Once data is collected the bacterial imaging device will automatically upload and disseminate results for mapping or intervention. THeir novel bacterial cartridge simplifies bacterial testing eliminating the need for a central lab and significant user training.

Full Description: Wanna Migrate is an online platform that helps individuals migrate to other countries regardless of the goals. It gathers the user's personal and professional information and cross it against a database of countries to find out the score in the points-based immigration system.  The result is a ranking of countries where the user has the best chances to get a visa, which can help to decrease skill shortages around the world. It collects data such as age, marital status, degree of education, field of work, and native language level among others. These criteria have different weights in each country, so the platform is always up-to-date to calculate the eligibility for many countries at the same place.  Wanna Migrate was founded by Márcio Oliveira and Humberto Moreira in 2013 and is based in São Luís, Brazil.

Walnut is a smart personal digital assistant that analyzes the SMS inbox of users to surface important and critical information, including expenses, bills, and tickets. Full Description: Wattage is a new approach in building personal electronics. One that eliminates the complexity of building hardware, so anyone can create beautifully designed, internet-connected products with nothing more than a browser and their imagination. The core of their platform is a WebGL-based product builder that makes creating hardware as simple as drag & drop. Various components such as buttons, sensors, lights, speakers, or screens can be easily added to any surface and positioned wherever you like. The device can be made larger or smaller, and you can select from a number of materials for the enclosure. Once complete, your virtual device is converted into a physical product. The parametrically-created enclosure is fabricated using a combination of laser cutters and 3D printers, and along with the various components, everything is packed and shipped, all for a reasonable price. With Wattage, customers can build, share, or remix hardware products in a way that hasn't been possible before.

They make studying Math as easy as watching a movie… a good one! As human beings, they are wired to learn through stories and the story structure keeps us curious and engaged. In a story they are presented first with an interesting problem that the hero is facing, then they get invested emotionally with him as he struggles to solve the problem then they feel relieved and happy when he wins at the end. Unfortunately, Math lessons are not written this way! In a Math lesson, students are first introduced to a mathematical concept that they don’t know where it came from and why is it important to know, then they are asked to use this concept to solve problems that are abstract and doesn’t mean anything to them! In Wade7.com, they are changing that! They re-write math lessons as stories and they relate them to real world applications that students use everyday. They then produce these lessons as animated videos that are not more than 3 min long each. They also provide students with a lot of exercises to solve so they can make sure they understood the lessons. Their product will have the inherited benefits of the internet. Students can access their lessons anytime anywhere. And unlike the private sessions, their lessons are very affordable and within reach for most Saudi students. On top of that, the way their lessons are produced , as animated stories, will make learning fun and easy. Students won’t feel that they are studying when they watch their videos!

Wami is a tech company that has been working in the travel industry since the end of 2012.  We offer a network of mobile guides that support travelers with a handy tool for smartphones and tablets to discover the best of a territory. The main focus of our guides is to enable a more genuine experience of the territory, providing travelers with everything they need to enjoy a city or a territory at its fullest - from local “pills of wisdom” about what to do and to see there to the access to services related to their staying, such as accommodation, dining, transportation, etc. Although travel is a crowded market, we feel that there is a big opportunity for us.  We’ve always been keen travelers and our experience taught us that when you’re planning a journey, you usually have a hard time trying to discern the trusted sources of information among the many options you have because of fake reviews, outdated information and poor suggestions.  That’s why we created Wami. Wami is like the local friend you would call for advice.  Our mobile guides combine up-to-date information of general interest coming from open data and social data with unique local tips. Content is taken from selected sources, validated and optimized: it features the main points of interest in the area and all the activities you can enjoy during the day and at night. Wami apps are free for the final users and boast state-of-the-art design, offline maps, offline content and a smart geolocated system called Amerigo, that can suggest you what to do according to your position, the time of the day and the weather conditions.  Also, users can count on geolocated services that are displayed in the exact moment they might need them. We take maximum care for the user experience, that we believe should be an outstanding travel experience, enabled and improved by technology. Wami is already on the market with 25 applications - native applications for iOS and Android devices and a HTML5 version that we developed as technical partners of local editors.  We’re currently switching to a new business model, though, where our philosophy is further enhanced and Wami has full control of the process. We are starting to profile our users and implementing a pay-per-person marketing strategy. The company is based in Treviso, Italy. We’re 6 people and 5 of us are software engineers. The founders, Enrico and Carlo, are both developers and they’ve been working together for over ten years. Carlo is currently in London, UK to explore the international opportunities for Wami. Our goal is to entirely cover Italy and to extend our reach to Europe and eventually overseas and we are looking for a seed investment to sustain both product development and business development.

Waffle.io is a free project management solution that enables development teams to plan, organize, and track their work using GitHub and GitHub Enterprise. Using cues in commits, branch naming, and pull requests, Waffle updates the status of work in real time. Cards can be labeled for organization and filtering, assigned to individual owners, and commented on. They can be filtered on board via labels, issue text, milestone, and owner. Developers can also bookmark and share the URL of their favorite filtered views. Waffle.io was launched in 2013 and is operated from Boulder, Colorado. It is part of [Rally Software](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/rally-software).

Full Description: Waste Connections, Inc. is an integrated solid waste services company that provides waste collection, transfer, disposal and recycling services in mostly exclusive and secondary markets in the U.S. and Canada. Through its R360 Environmental Solutions subsidiary, the Company is also a leading provider of non-hazardous oilfield waste treatment, recovery and disposal services in several of the most active natural resource producing areas in the United States, including the Permian, Bakken and Eagle Ford Basins. Waste Connections serves more than six million residential, commercial, industrial, and exploration and production customers from a network of operations in 39 states, six provinces and the District of Columbia. The Company also provides intermodal services for the movement of cargo and solid waste containers in the Pacific Northwest. Our corporate strategy targets secondary and suburban markets that have strong demographic growth trends and where competitive barriers to entry can be developed. We seek to avoid highly competitive, large urban markets and target markets where we can provide either non-integrated or integrated solid waste services under exclusive arrangements, or markets where we can be integrated and attain high market share. We are a leading provider of solid waste services in most of our markets, and approximately 50% of our revenues are derived from market areas where we have franchise or exclusive rights to provide our waste services.

Full Description: WaterPlay USA features the nation's largest travel website and software reservation platform for booking/reserving water related tours and activities such as surfing lessons and paddle board rentals to fishing charters and dinner cruises. walkWELL is a remote rehabilitation platform that accesses sensor technology to drive adherence to physical therapy and track functional recovery in patient's everyday lives.  Our first product, Loop+ is an activity tracker for wheelchairs. Instead of tracking steps, our Loop+ Mat tracks weight bearing and body alignment.  As a rehabilitation platform, walkWELL translates prescribed physical therapy exercises from the clinic into the home. The real time, data-driven feedback loop and interaction between patient and healthcare providers increases motivation and compliance to prescribed exercises. Tracking microgoals gives patients a sense of achievement, lifting motivation and confidence to form healthy habits in their every day lives.  walkWELL: positive feedback for functional recovery and independence.

HOW IMPORTANT ARE COWORKERS FOR YOUR ORGANIZATION? A modern company thrives on its people. It must create: a feeling of belonging to a united, human-centered organization; happiness, the natural driver for productivity; empathy, for sinergy between colleagues of all departments and company locations; informal relations , the true glue for a successful company community. YOUR PEOPLE, HAPPY AS THEY ARE. Walife is the only life app that switches your community on and makes it thrive. How? With its unique user experience and its new passion-based algorithm. Behind each colleague there is a world of passions and interests (#trekking, #familytime, #soccer, #theater, #guitar, and thousands more). Walife makes them live and match, creating fun and useful connections among coworkers from all departments and company locations. Yes, Walife is not for work tasks. Walife is for creating the pillars on which a modern successful company relies on: fruitful human relations. Think about it as a big, virtual coffee-break room where all colleagues are finally able to know each other, share common passions, organize fun activities, find opportunities, promote exchange and more. EMOTIONAL ENGAGEMENT. Companies need their people to be on-board, not just as professionals, but as whole persons. While Walife promotes lively human relations, internal sentiment and employee engagement improve. Here, connections grow based on people and mutual passions, rather than work and roles. SPONTANEOUS, NATURAL TEAM BUILDING. Although important, classic team building is often top-down and unaware of coworkers’ true interests. Through interest-matching, Walife enables an easier, peer-to-peer, natural team building. Fun drivers or utility drivers let people group up, while spontaneously creating a stronger community. OPPORTUNITIES FROM COLLEAGUES. Along with fun and passions, usefulness is a powerful driver for creating a community. With Walife’s algorithm, colleagues easily share tips on relevant life issues, they exchange goods and much more  (p2p work-life balance). In short, they discover how useful and worthwhile their community can be. BENEFITS ON TARGET. Peer-to-peer fun and usefulness build a great community for all colleagues. Now, the company can use the community to be a great partner for the life of its people. With Walife’s algorithm, welfare initiatives and benefits can be promoted and targeted on the app, increasing satisfaction and conversion rates. THIS IS WALIFE. Switch your community on, and let it thrive. Give your people a long-lasting gift and let them connect with Walife. Want more? Walife generates unprecedented, cumulative and real-time knowledge on your people and your community. You can use it to improve your HR strategies and your business, helped by Walife's angels.

Full Description: Wachovia Bank operates as a financial holding company that provides commercial and retail banking services in the United States and internationally. Ever felt uneasy navigating new waters? Wanted to know a friend’s location? Or looking for the best place to launch your boat or anchor for the night?  The Wavve Boating app makes on-the-water navigation and collaboration as simple, intuitive, and accessible as Google Maps and Waze make land travel. With Wavve, boaters get the navigation experience they expect in 2017. App Features: Intuitive Navigation Experience - Using GPS location services available in all smartphones, Wavve plots your real-time location on the map so you can see exactly where you are in relation to land, markers, and those dreaded shoals. Your location icon also indicates your current direction based on your vessel’s bearing.  Customized Charts - Wavve’s innovative approach allows you to view and manipulate charts based on your unique needs and preferences. You choose your draft to create the map experience most relevant to your vessel. Wavve’s proprietary interface strives to present digital charts as simply as possible – anywhere that’s shaded red is shallower than your specified draft. Zoom in your map view to see sounding data for these danger areas only, or zoom in further to access all available soundings. You can also filter to find mooring locations, boat ramps, marinas, and more using our map pin functionality. Collaborative Contribution Our map pinning functionality allows users to share their knowledge of the waterways by adding mooring, boat ramp, marina, fishing, and point of interest locations directly to the map. The community also validates all pins using a voting system.  Safety (and fun!) in Numbers With Wavve, you can enable location sharing to allow other Wavve users to see where you are. Of course, this also means you can see where other boaters are as well.  The Wavve Boating app is available for a free fourteen trial and is just 99 cents a month to continue your subscription.

Wawa, Inc., a privately held company, began in 1803 as an iron foundry in New Jersey. Toward the end of the 19th Century, owner George Wood took an interest in dairy farming and the family began a small processing plant in Wawa, Pa, in 1902. The milk business was a huge success, due to its quality, cleanliness and “certified” process. As home delivery of milk declined in the early 1960s, Grahame Wood, George’s grandson, opened the first Wawa Food Market in 1964 as an outlet for dairy products. Today, Wawa is your all day, every day stop for fresh, built-to-order foods, beverages, coffee, fuel services, and surcharge-free ATMs. A chain of more than 645 convenience retail stores (over 365 offering gasoline), Wawa stores are located in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia and Central Florida. The stores offer a large fresh food service selection, including Wawa brands such as built-to-order hoagies, freshly brewed coffee, hot breakfast sandwiches, built-to-order specialty beverages, and an assortment of soups, sides and snacks.

A search engine that gives completely the wrong search results. Users search as they would in a traditional search engine, but are given a results list of completely unrelated sites.  The company's logo is a duck, and the tagline for the site is "you'll be amazed how wrong he can be". Conceived in 2009, after a discussion about whether anyone still 'surfed', or whether they tended to visit a handful of well-known sites for news, email, and social or business networking, and whether the increasing acuracy of search engines had taken much of the fun out of using the Internet. The site was launched on June 25th, 2010. A major enhancement to the site is due August 2010: 'Duck feeder'.

Walker Tracker was one of the first platforms to offer activity challenges to companies seeking healthier employees and lower health-care costs.  We're trying to change the world. We're trying to get you and us and everyone we know off the elevator and out of the car and onto the sidewalks and trails.  We're doing it one step at a time. Get up, stand up, and walk. We believe in the democracy of walking. We believe that just about everyone could be happier, healthier, saner, smarter, faster, tougher and better looking by just adding a few extra minutes per day of walking. Full Description: Wash Cycle Laundry will pick up your dirty laundry on a bike and bring it back clean tomorrow. Cleaning clothes can be dirty business. They use eco-friendly "free and clear" laundry detergents for all their wash-and-fold, and only non-perc solvents for all their dry cleaning.  Most standard dry cleaners use "PERC" in their dry cleaning process, which the State of California believes to be a carcinogen. Their cargo tricycles and bike trailers come equipped with rods for hanging dry cleaning and enough cargo capacity to service entire nursing homes (which, incidentally, they do!)  Next-day service is standard, and in some cities they can pick-up, clean, and deliver your clothes in the same day. Book an appointment online for pick-up today or in the future.  Running late or unexpected change of plans?  A few taps and you can re-book your appointment for a more convenient time without penalty. Or, if you'd prefer to talk to a human, call 888.611.9274 to speak to Sandra or Noelle on their amazing customer care team, available M-F, 7am-8:30pm (Eastern). Why get your clothes wrapped in plastic every single time you need to clean them?  They'll give you snazzy, reusable garment bags and laundry bags with your first order.  Want to recycle those wire hangers, too? Just throw them in with your order and they'll make sure they get dozens of more uses before they make it to the landfill. Wash Cycle Laundry operates specialized facilities capable of producing hygenically-clean linen for medical and healthcare customers. They can provide daily service to customers used to weekly deliveries, and regularly win cost-competitive contract awards.

Safety is a base need which affects everyone, and crime is a problem that affects every city. Which is why we built Watch Over Me. Watch Over Me is an app that turns your smartphone into a powerful personal safety device. Whether you’re going for a run, walking to your car, walking home, taking a cab, or meeting someone for the first time, all you have to do is let Watch Over Me know and it'll watch over you via GPS throughout your journey. If you fail to check-in safely once you're done, Watch Over Me will alert your emergency contact list immediately and provide them with your location on a map. Watch Over Me now also alerts you the moment you enter an area that is flagged as "high crime" so you know to be more vigilant when you enter the area. We are collecting millions of data points from official sources and crowdsourced reports to be able to tell you which areas are dangerous. As of May 2014, Watch Over Me has over 140,000 users and has been downloaded in over 100 countries.

WalkHub is a web application that makes it easy to record and share Walkthrough tutorials that play on top of websites (similar to the "Take the tour" you've seen on Google maps, Facebook,...). Full Description: The savvier shoppers among us understand that buying pre-owned luxury watches is the smart way to go. After all, pre-owned fine timepieces already took their biggest depreciation hit when the first buyer left the retail store. And since high-end watches are built to last several lifetimes, the only thing you’re really missing by buying an authentic watch in great condition from the secondary market is the hefty retail price tag.  However, just like any secondary market, there are some precautions to take to ensure that you’re getting your money’s worth. The pre-owned luxury watch space is a robust market with plenty of sources to buy and sell used timepieces. But, how do you know if the seller is a trustworthy one and more importantly, how do you know if the watch you’re buying is the real deal? Enter WatchFacts, a third-party certification program that does all the work for you so you know exactly what you’re buying.   Just like customers depend on Carfax reports to inform them about the history of a used car, WatchFacts provides detailed certification reports about secondhand luxury watches. Using a proprietary grading system and a standardized inspection process, a WatchFacts Report includes a WatchFacts Score, which gives you a quick overview of the overall condition of the watch.  A top WatchFacts Score of 100 indicates that the watch is in unworn/like new condition, followed by different scores for excellent, very good, and so on. Along with the score, a WatchFacts Report provides other essential information such as brand, model, date of production, movement, materials, authenticity check, theft check, current performance, and information about any previous servicing.  Buying from a WatchFacts partner network minimizes your risk when purchasing from the secondary luxury watch market since you’ll have access to a WatchFacts Report. Plus, seeing as WatchFacts’ goal is customer peace of mind, if something goes wrong, WatchFacts will intercede on your behalf so you are content with your purchase.  Shoppers can take advantage of a vast selection of products by buying certified pre-owned luxury watches from Amazon, eBay, and Jomashop. Every watch listed as “Certified Pre-Owned” on Amazon and Jomashop comes with a one-year limited warranty and a WatchFacts Report so you can rest assured that the timepiece delivered to your doorstep will meet all your expectations. Furthermore, pre-owned timepieces offered by Kay Jewelers, Jared, and Zales have all been inspected by WatchFacts.  With a WatchFacts report in hand, buying a pre-owned luxury watch is no longer a guessing game but now it’s a safe, secure, and transparent process.

WARSTUFF is a bit like eBay, but only for war stuff, militaria and military antiques. Founded in 2010, WARSTUFF connects militaria collectors and dealers in the fastest growing marketplace just for war and military memorabilia. Unlike eBay which bans the sale of some of the military items collectors are interested in, WARSTUFF has usage policies to suit all of the niche. All types of antique deactivated weapons, WW2 items, collectable blades and inert ordinance can be bought and sold, as well as the usual uniforms, medals, helmets and other interesting military items that generalist sites permit. The company also provides a militaria valuations service via WARSTUFF Valued which for a fee helps customers value their militaria through a written appraisal of their item by an expert. This is based on a description and photos of the items the customer supplies. WARSTUFF operates a subscription fee model for marketplace Sellers and the service is free for Buyers. It is building a sizeable database of paying customers from around the globe who all have a dedicated interest in collecting militaria. WARSTUFF also has a growing following via social media and its monthly e-newsletter. WARSTUFF items can be sold either via a silent auction, or via “Buy It Now,” with which they purchase items at a set price. WARSTUFF offers a mobile version, offers free widgets of items, free WANTED ads, allows bulk imports by RSS or CSV as well as imports directly from eBay.  WARSTUFF maintains 20 satellite sites aimed at collectors and dealers with interests in specific conflicts such as the Vietnam War (Vietnam WARSTUFF) or the Napoleonic Wars (Napoleonic WARSTUFF). A number of noteable war relics have been placed for sale on WARSTUFF including a restored 1970s Hawker Harrier Jump Jet for static display that eBay publically rejected as it contravened their weapons policy, and a Hawker Hurricane WW2 fighter plane in flying condition that carried a price tag of £2m.

Founded in February 2002, WatchMouse is a global industry leader in self-service website and application performance monitoring. WatchMouse product tests the behaviour and availability of websites, services and applications utilizing an infrastructure that includes 50 worldwide remote monitoring stations and a global network of checkpoints in 35 countries.  WatchMouse offers web based solutions to monitor the performance and security of sites by simulating regular visits from its monitoring network. WatchMouse tells you if visitors can reach your site, if the basic interactions and click paths work, and whether they do so within the clients performance limits. WatchMouse conducts checks from an external perspective to replicate real-time user experience and writes transaction monitoring scripts to identify a wide variety of possible issues, from slow page response times, to monitoring the behaviour of forms such as login pages and shopping carts. Advanced remote monitoring helps eliminate website downtime and allows issues to be identified and resolved quickly before they result in lost revenues or customers. WatchMouse's web-based products are easily deployed and offer many features including extensive reporting tools and automated email and text/SMS alerts. Many of the world's leading companies utilize and depend on WatchMouse to provide independent confirmation of both in-house and suppliers' website performance. WatchMouse offers customer support in nine languages and payments in five currencies, and supports a broad international customer base.  WatchMouse is a privately held company headquartered in Utrecht, The Netherlands.

Warner–Lambert was a large U.S.-based pharmaceutical company engaged in a range of business activities.  The company was founded in 1856 when William Warner launched his own drug store in Philadelphia. He started his business by producing sweet tasting tablets to encase unpleasant tasting medicines. His business was merged with Lambert Pharmacal Company in 1955, creating Warner-Lambert Pharmaceutical Company. Lambert Pharmacal Company was famous for its Listerine product.  The new company grew through a strategy of acquisitions. The company acquired American Chicle Company in 1962, well known as the producer of Chiclets. The company also acquired Parke-Davis in 1970, once the world's largest drug maker. The company acquired  Wilkinson Sword in 1993. Warner-Lambert was eventually acquired by Pfizer in 2000.

Our mission is to provide clean water to people in need and give to everyone the possibility to solve the problem of water in the world, by transforming an ordinary act in something extraordinary. Why water? Water is the most important resource we have, but still today 700 million people do not have access to clean water. Most of these people live in rural and isolated areas and have to walk long hours to get the water necessary for the survival of their family. Lack of drinkable water not only endangers people's health, but also takes away a lot of valuable time from women and children who usually take care of the supply. What can we do? With every WAMI bottle, you donate 100 litres of clean water. Thanks to a simple act, you help us build water projects in villages in need and change the world one bottle at a time.  Our water flows down the Italian Alps at 1600 metres above the sea level, from an oligo-mineral source known for its organoleptic properties. By choosing this brand, everyday-water-consumers have the possibility to make the change in the world in an ethical and responsible way.    In addition of giving access to drinkable water to villages in need, WAMI is also committed to sustainability. The packaging is 100% recyclable and made with 50% recycled r-PET plastic, the maximum allowed in Italy. Moreover, in order to minimize the environmental impact and to contribute to the reabsorption of CO2, the start-up plants trees in Italy in collaboration with Rete Clima.

Wazetrip.com is a startup located in the east side of the great Seattle area in the United States. It is found in 2013.  Wazetrip is striving to provide great benefits to both travelers and hotel booking partners. We introduced a number of innovations to significantly improve the hotel booking experience. Why travelers should choose wazetrip.com? The mission of Wazetrip is – one click to find the desired hotels: low price, high quality, great location, etc.  Study shows that in US travelers take an average of 3.5 hours to find and book a hotel. The time can be even longer in some other countries. Although there are some booking sites to help making the process easier, travelers still spend a lot of time on things like comparing prices from multiple sites, looking up addresses on map tools, etc. The question is can we have a place where travelers can easily find every information they need so that they can make the booking much faster and smoother? Wazetrip.com provides an all-in-one solution to solve these problems. Here is the typical process of hotel booker to use wazetrip. 1. Find the best location  If hotel booker already have stored travel plans and activities in their TripIt account, Google calendar or Outlook calendar, wazetrip let hotel booker to import their travel activities onto map by just clicking a button. Once the travel activities are on map, hotel booker can easily see which hotels are closer to their travel activities and make best decision.  If hotel booker don’t have stored travel plans, they can easily pin their desired visiting address in our address bar onto map and see which hotel is closer to it.  No travel activities decided yet? That is OK. Wazetrip can help you. Our categorized P.O.I (point of interest) will show 10,000+ popular visiting points in U.S. Traveler can decide which point to visit by looking at the reviews, photos etc. The distance information to the P.O.I from any hotel on map will pop up when you click any hotel.  2. Find the best quality As other meta search website, wazetrip provides hotel and room photos, TripAdvisor reviews, amenities, policies information too, but in a more organized way.  In addition, our street view on map provide hotel booker an interactive view of the hotel. For 50% of hotels, wazetrip can provide indoor 3D view to let hotel booker feel they were really walking in the hotel.  3. Find the lowest price  Wazetrip searches 200,000+ hotels through dozens hotel booking sites. It is guaranteed to find the lowest price hotels that meet your needs.  Hotel price fluctuate as travel time changes. Wazetrip provides a trend chart in next 9 months for every hotel to let hotel bookers to find the best time to have lowest price.  Whether you are traveling for business or personal leisure, you can always find great hotels through wazetrip.com!

It simultaneously online monitor and supervise all nationwide cellular antennas and can compare the radiation emitted in practice from every antenna to the conditions set in the permits granted by the Radiation Regulator. The system can identify and alerts the radiation supervisor from any exceeded cellular radiation activity from the permitted radiation standard. Full Description: Wahoha is a free content exchange service for online publishers that increases the traffic of all sites in the network on a contextual basis. Patrons of the service can expect to receive significant increases in their average daily traffic volumes for no financial cost and minimal administration time.  The exchange is facilitated by a content widget that all participating websites are required to display in order to benefit from the service. The widget essentially operates as a discovery engine that is continually optimising itself to present relevant and interesting content in front of its partners' audience. Once installed by a publisher, popular content from other blogs in the network will then be displayed in this widget. For every click on the widget received, anywhere from 2 to 3 unique visitors will be sent back from other publishers in the network. (A 200% - 300% traffic return rate).

Wal-Mart de México y Centroamérica (BMV: WALMEXV), is a Mexican public corporation, subsidiary of Walmart. It has been traded in the Mexican Stock Exchange since 1977 (as Cifra). The company was founded in 1958 as Cifra by Jerónimo Arango. The company grew and in 1991 Cifra and Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., signed a joint venture agreement. This agreement allowed cooperation between the two companies and the opening of Walmart stores and Sam's Clubs in Mexico. Then in 1997 Walmart increased its stake by acquiring 51% of Cifra stock. Once the acquisition was completed Cifra was renamed, the new company became Wal-Mart de Mexico, S.A. de C.V. Walmart again increased its stake in Wal-Mart de Mexico to 60% in April 2000.[2] After completing the acquisition of Walmart's operations in Central America, in January 2010, Walmart Mexico absorbed Walmart Centroamérica and changed their name to Walmart de Mexico y Centroamérica.
